item.description:
With temps in the 50's, it's time for one more ride before winter returns!

The route: http://www.gmap-pedometer.com/?r=5751503
We start out from the Lexington Depot and hit a medium-sized hill right away, just to make sure we are all in the same boat and ready for a 37-mile 12-14mph ride :) Then we head out scenic Marrett Rd, into Lincoln where we hit the biggest climb of the ride, Lincoln Hill. The next 7 miles are my favorite part, quietly winding south through Lincoln and Sudbury. We do 1 mile of Rt 27 to cross the Sudbury River, and then head north for 10 scenic miles to our rest stop in Concord Center (at the 26-mile mark). Then we finish up with Monument St to Rt 225 to the Minuteman Bikeway back to the Lexington Depot.

When:
Let's meet up at 12:00pm and be ready to start at 12:15pm. Aiming to be back by 3:45pm.

Where:
Lexington Depot, right by the water fountain. Parking is free on Sundays in the big lot.

Who:
You need to be okay with a 12-14 mph average pace, and some significant hills. We will wait for everyone at the top of major hills and at confusing intersections, but otherwise we want to keep a decent pace going.

What's required:
* Road bike (or equivalent) in good repair
* Bike helmet
* At least one full large water bottle (you can refill in Concord Ctr)
* Warm gloves and socks
* Layers appropriate for riding in 50-55 degree weather

What's recommended:
* Energy bar or some other snack
* Spare tube, air, and basic repair tools
* Cell phone
item.name: 37 Mile loop: Lexington, Lincoln, Sudbury, Concord, Bedford
